name: Difficult History Trivia: Asian History | 10 Questions

questions.text: In China, what did Shih Huang-Ti (Shihuangdi) build as a defense against raids by nomadic people?
questions.explanation:
Great Wall.

	The Great Wall of China is the longest artificial structure in the world.

questions.text: In India, who was the philosopher who founded Buddhism?
In the Philippines, who was the Filipino hero of World War II?
In Indonesia, who was their first President?
questions.explanation:
Sukarno.

	He was the president of Indonesia from 1945 to 1967, when right wing military leaders took power after a failed Communist coup.

questions.text: In Oman, who overthrew Sultan Said bin Taimur in a palace coup in 1970?
questions.explanation:
Qaboos bin Said.

	Qaboos bin Said is the son of Sultan Said bin Taimur.

questions.text: In Mongolia, what city was designated as Temujin's capital?
questions.explanation:
Karakorum.

	Temujin (later known at Ghengis Khan) estabished Karakorum as the capital of the Mongol empire in the early 13th century.

questions.text: When did Brunei become an independent sovereign country?
In Laos, who did the Khmer King at Angkor, Jayavarman Paramesvara, have his daughter marry?
questions.explanation:
Fa Ngum.

	He was a great warrior who earned the title Conqueror.

questions.text: Which Asian country became the first Christian state in the History of the World in A.D. 301?
What was the first kingdom to occupy the present area of Cambodia?
questions.explanation:
Funan.

	This was formed in the 1st century A.D., probably by the Mon-Khmer peoples.
